subject.normal: "hg rollback" doesn't work like the hgbook suggests

headers.subject: "hg rollback" doesn't work like the hgbook suggests
headers.received: by el-out-1112.google.com with SMTP id v27so124489ele.17 for <mercurial@selenic.com>; Tue, 10 Feb 2009 17:36:16 -0800 (PST)

body.para: I'm sure there are discrepancies with the current hg and what the book has but I wanted to email the list to better understand. Basically, I'm learning how to use "hg backout" to remove changes committed to a repository. Here are the steps I've followed:

I started with 9.3.1 and continued through 9.3.3. The problem is when I run "hg rollback", I end up with a conflicted myfile. Even using merge tools like FileMerge (OS X) and ediff end up with the conflict being so that there is no way to get what the book suggests without manual intervention. I copied/pasted all commands. Instead of:
I end up with a file that needs to be manually merged with a merge tool and at best, I can only end up with either "first change" or:

unless I modify the conflict myself. What did I do wrong? I'm using Mercurial 1.1 on OS X and I've tried using the FileMerge and ediff. (ediff was hooked up via the http://www.selenic.com/mercurial/wiki/index.cgi/MergingWithEmacs wiki page.) Without a merge command specified, I end up with the following in the conflicted file:
first change <<<<<<< local second change third change =======
If I can provide anything else, please let me know. I can kind of see why the conflict is the way it is but I'll leave it up to you to let me know if there is something I did wrong.
